item.title: 受天气和利率影响，美国成屋待完成销售降至历史最低点
item.description: 由于恶劣的冬季天气导致房屋销售活动放缓，消费者在重要的春季销售季节到来之前对高房价和抵押贷款利率望而却步，1 月份美国现房待售量下滑至历史最低点。【原文：Pending sales of existing US homes slumped to a record low in January as severe winter weather slowed activity and consumers balked at high prices and mortgage rates ahead of the vital spring selling season.】

item.title: 民调显示：特朗普面临美国消费者对关税反弹的风险
item.description:
在哈里斯民意调查（Harris Poll ）中，大多数受访者表示总统的关税计划将增加日常用品的成本。【原文：

A majority of respondents in a Harris Poll say the president’s tariff plans will increase the cost of everyday goods.

】

item.title: 特朗普确认 3 月对加拿大和墨西哥征收关税，美元飙升
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统表示对美国邻国征收 25% 的关税将于下周生效后，美元反弹，导致墨西哥比索和加拿大卢比下滑。【原文：The US dollar rallied after President Donald Trump said 25% tariffs on neighboring US nations are on track to go into effect next week, sending Mexico’s peso and Canada’s loonie sliding.】

item.title: 私募股权投资的零排放赌注带来大量零回报
item.description: 私募股权公司在可再生能源领域的押注面临着清醒的反思。简而言之，很多初创企业的价值还不如他们的赞助商为其支付的费用，其中一些零排放企业的价值甚至为零。【原文：Private equity firms face a sober reckoning on their renewable energy bets. Simply put, a lot of those startups aren’t worth nearly what their sponsors paid for them, and some of those zero-emission ventures are just plain zeroes.】

item.title: 施密德称美联储可能需要平衡增长担忧与通胀之间的关系
item.description: 堪萨斯城联邦储备银行行长杰夫-施密德（Jeff Schmid）对通胀预期升温和经济增长担忧发出警告，提醒美国央行可能很快就会同时面对这两个问题。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City President Jeff Schmid sounded a warning about rising inflation expectations and concerns over economic growth, cautioning that the US central bank may soon confront both.】

item.title: Blackstone Hires McKinsey Veteran to Helm Portfolio Operations
item.description: Blackstone Inc. tapped a longtime McKinsey & Co. executive to steer the operators behind the $1.1 trillion private equity firm’s portfolio companies.

item.title: 特朗普称加拿大、墨西哥关税将生效，新增对华关税
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统表示，对加拿大和墨西哥征收 25% 的关税将于 3 月 4 日如期实施，并表示将对中国进口商品额外征收 10% 的关税。【原文：President Donald Trump said 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico are on track to go into place on March 4, and said he would impose an additional 10% tax on Chinese imports.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织认为印度经济风险在全球不确定性中上升
item.description: 国际货币基金组织称，印度举世瞩目的经济增长面临着地缘经济分化和国内需求放缓带来的不利因素，印度应实施关键的结构性改革，以实现其成为发达国家的雄心壮志。【原文：India’s world-beating economic growth faces headwinds from geoeconomic fragmentation and slower domestic demand, and it should implement crucial structural reforms to realize its ambition of becoming a developed country, according to the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 微软敦促特朗普政府放宽芯片出口限制
item.description: 微软公司（Microsoft Corp.微软公司总裁布拉德-史密斯（Brad Smith）正敦促特朗普政府重新考虑有关规定，这些规定将限制向包括以色列和瑞士在内的 "具有重要战略意义的市场 "出口人工智能芯片。【原文：Microsoft Corp. President Brad Smith is urging the Trump administration to rethink regulations that would cap the export of artificial intelligence chips to “strategically vital markets” including Israel and Switzerland.】

item.title: 美国初请失业金人数创 2025 年新高，华盛顿特区裁员人数激增
item.description: 在企业和联邦机构裁员公告增加的情况下，美国失业救济金申请量升至今年最高。【原文：Applications for US unemployment benefits rose to the highest this year, amid an increase in job-cuts announcements at corporations and federal agencies.】

item.title: 2024 年底美国国内生产总值保持稳定，通胀率则有所上升
item.description: 2024 年底，美国经济健康发展，通货膨胀比最初估计的更为顽固。【原文：The US economy advanced at a healthy pace and inflation was more stubborn than initially estimated at the end of 2024.】

item.title: 为什么世界大国都在争夺计算机芯片？
item.description: 计算机芯片是数字经济的引擎，其不断增长的功能正在催生生成式人工智能等技术，有望改变多个行业。【原文：Computer chips are the engine of the digital economy, and their growing capabilities are enabling technologies such as generative artificial intelligence that promise to transform multiple industries.】

item.title: 伦敦黄金协会副会长离职创业
item.description: 伦敦金银市场协会（London Bullion Market Association —）是贵金属市场事实上的全球标准制定者，该协会的副首席执行官即将离职，加入一家即将推出黄金基金的初创公司。【原文：The deputy chief executive of the London Bullion Market Association — the de facto global standard-setter for precious metal markets — is leaving to join a startup that’s launching a gold fund.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮推动股价上涨，SAP 首席执行官获得创纪录的 1900 万欧元薪酬
item.description: SAP SE 首席执行官克里斯蒂安-克莱因（Christian Klein）获得了有史以来最大一笔薪酬，人工智能的蓬勃发展使这家德国软件公司的股价创下历史新高。【原文：SAP SE’s Chief Executive Officer Christian Klein got his largest-ever compensation package, as the boom in artificial intelligence helped send the German software company’s share price to a record high.】

item.title: 奥斯汀大规模建房，房租从峰值暴跌 22
item.description:
一位租户免费租用两个月，签订租约可获得600美元的优惠

【原文：

One tenant got two months free, $600 credit for signing lease as deals abound

】

item.title: Life360 收购 Fantix 部门，提升人工智能驱动的广告能力
item.description: 位置共享服务 Life360 公司收购了 Fantix 公司的一个部门，该部门利用人工智能提供更有针对性的广告服务。【原文：Location-sharing service Life360 Inc. has acquired a Fantix Inc. unit that uses artificial intelligence to offer more targeted advertising.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员认为继续采取限制性政策是安全的
item.description: 根据欧洲中央银行 1 月份会议的描述，该行官员有信心继续将其货币政策设定描述为对经济的抑制。【原文：European Central Bank officials were confident in continuing to describe their monetary-policy settings as restraining the economy, according to an account of their January meeting.】

item.title: 降息为经济注入动力，土耳其即将走出衰退
item.description: 土耳其很可能在第四季度摆脱了技术性衰退，这支持了分析师对土耳其今年在央行降息周期的帮助下实现更强劲增长的预期。【原文：Turkey likely emerged from a technical recession in the fourth quarter, supporting analysts’ expectations of stronger growth this year, aided by a cycle of interest-rate cuts from the central bank.】

item.title: 比特币储备法案在各国接连失败
item.description: 虽然今年早些时候推动州政府以某种方式持有数字资产的呼声很高，但上个月有四个州的加密货币储备法案以失败告终。【原文：While the push for state governments to hold digital assets in one way or another generated momentum earlier this year, crypto reserve bills in four states have failed over the last month.】

item.title: 阿波罗的斯洛克警告说，一个更加分化的世界将引发通货膨胀
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）的托斯滕-斯洛克（Torsten Slok）认为，从全球化走向更加分散的世界，很可能会导致各地区的通货膨胀率长期走高。【原文：The move away from globalization toward a more fragmented world is likely to fuel permanently higher inflation across regions, according to Apollo Global Management’s Torsten Slok.】

item.title: 据称金达尔将把对意大利钢铁制造商的收购价提高至 40 亿欧元
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士称，金达尔钢铁公司将其对一家陷入困境的意大利钢铁制造商的收购报价提高至约 40 亿欧元（42 亿美元），试图击败来自阿塞拜疆的竞争对手。【原文：Jindal Steel raised its offer for a troubled Italian steelmaker to about €4 billion ($4.2 billion), seeking to outbid rivals from Azerbaijan, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 拆分英国石油公司将危及其有利可图的交易优势
item.description:
在过去五年中，这些业务为公司的资本回报率带来了约 4% 的平均提升。【原文：

Those operations delivered an average uplift of about 4% to the company’s return on capital during the past five years.

】

item.title: 阿曼航运公司可能定价最高，融资 3.33 亿美元
item.description: 一家由阿曼主权财富基金支持的物流集团可能会将其航运部门的上市定价定在最高点，筹集 1.281 亿里亚尔（约合 3.327 亿美元）的资金。【原文：A logistics group backed by Oman’s sovereign wealth fund is likely to price its shipping unit’s listing at the top of the range, raising 128.1 million riyals ($332.7 million).】

item.title: 腾讯发布 Turbo AI 模型，称其速度超过 DeepSeek
item.description: 腾讯控股有限公司（Tencent Holdings Ltd.）也加入了与 DeepSeek 竞争的公司行列，吹嘘其最新人工智能模型的速度有多快。【原文：Tencent Holdings Ltd. joined the ranks of companies measuring themselves against DeepSeek by touting how much faster its latest AI model is.】

item.title: 安哥拉颁布法令，可能通过欧洲债券筹集多达30亿美元资金
item.description: 安哥拉财政部长已获准通过欧元债券融资多达30亿美元，通过出售日元债券融资最多10亿美元，为该国2025年支出计划提供资金。【原文：Angola’s finance minister has received approval to raise as much as $3 billion in eurobonds and at most $1 billion through the sale of yen-denominated bonds to fund the country’s 2025 spending plan.】

item.title: 中央银行鹰派政策推动兹罗提飙升至 10 年高点
item.description: 兹罗提对欧元的汇率飙升至十年来的最高水平，令出口商和波兰政府感到震惊，升值加剧了对中央银行紧缩利率政策的担忧。【原文：The zloty surged to the highest level against the euro in a decade, alarming exporters and the Polish government, with the appreciation exacerbating concerns over the central bank’s tight interest rate policy.】

item.title: 劳斯莱斯首席执行官将公司的 "燃烧平台 "推向新高度
item.description: 在担任劳斯莱斯控股公司（Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc）首席执行官的两年时间里，Tufan Erginbilgic 将这家曾被他讥讽为 "燃烧的平台 "的公司变成了振兴奄奄一息的工业偶像的案例研究。【原文：In his two years as chief executive officer of Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc, Tufan Erginbilgic has turned the company he once derided as a “burning platform” into a case study for reviving a moribund industrial icon.】

item.title: 马哈马称加纳经济困境比预期严重
item.description: 加纳新总统表示，在对国有机构的债务进行初步评估后，加纳的经济状况比他预期的要糟糕。【原文：Ghana’s new president says the economy is worse off than he expected after an initial assessment of state-owned agencies’ debt.】

item.title: 2025 年伊始，巴西失业率增幅低于预期
item.description: 今年年初，巴西失业率的增幅低于预期，这是拉丁美洲最大经济体的劳动力市场正在经受借贷成本上升考验的最新迹象。【原文：Brazil’s unemployment rate rose less than expected at the start of the year, the latest sign that the labor market in Latin America’s largest economy is weathering higher borrowing costs.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克就前推特员工离职问题进行的代价高昂、效率低下的斗争
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，库尔特-瓦格纳（Kurt Wagner）将报道埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）为避免向被解雇的 Twitter 员工支付遣散费而进行的斗争。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Kurt Wagner reports on Elon Musk’s battle to avoid severance payments to fired Twitter employees.】
